column5: Just thought that others might be interested in hearing this guy.  https://www.google.ca/search?client=firefox-b-ab&dcr=0&ei=fiu5WuT4E4nmsAXq3qzABw&q=sounds+of+silence+18+string+guitar&oq=sounds+of+silence+18+string+guitar&gs_l=psy-ab.3..0.9810.13334.0.15182.17.3.0.14.14.0.106.298.2j1.3.0....0...1c.1.64.psy-ab..0.17.418...0i67k1j0i22i30k1.0.ejSiBETwg0Y
This guys stuff is rediculous. I've played guitar for 30 yrs and still never go past the 5th fret LOL  S.
From the other end of the guitar talent spectrum
Very cool thanks for sharing that. I take guitar lessons and there is a photo of that guitar on the wall in the lesson room.
Here is a video I took in Barcelona of a really cool guitar.  It was like the love child of a guitar, a sitar, and a slide guitar.  Really cool vibe. https://youtu.be/PRwYkDz42f0

I've enjoyed this pair for a lot of years , Lindley is the master of any stringed instrument, Cooder is now slouch either. Lindley also played a lot with Jackson Browne, loved his falsetto on the song "Stay" and he had his own band for a while too. Good watch , you'll see some pretty unique instruments.
